[color=white][b]New Prefix in Member Contests Forum[/b][/color]
After a suggestion was made by the user [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2408983][b]Sterling Archer[/b][/url] regarding a new subforum for puzzles and/or challenges in the member contests forum, our administrator [url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1][color=#FF66FF][b]Omniscient[/b][/color][/url] has added the 'Puzzle' prefix to the section.[i][size=x-small][url=https://hackforums.net/showthread.php?tid=5463237] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[color=transparent]       [/color]

[b][color=white]Group Changes[/color][/b]
[list]
[*][url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=2061024][b]Raymond Reddington[/b][/url] has chosen the two new leaders for his group, Legends. Congratulations to [b][url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=275104]ra1d[/url][/b] and [b][url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1306528]xadamxk[/url][/b].

 [align=left][size=x-small][color=white][b]*[/b][/color]As of the Tuesday prior to release.[/size][/align]

[hr]

[align=center][IMG]http://hackforums.news/assets/v3/Interview/318.gif[/IMG][/align]

[align=center]
[color=1E90FF][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]Interview[/font][/size][/color] [color=white][size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva]-[/font][/size][/color] [size=large][font=Monotype Corsiva][url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=767395]01001[/url][/font][/size][spoiler=][align=left]

[hr]

[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1957866][color=#00ffff][b]Enterpriser[/b][/color][/url]: 01001, welcome to the weekly news interview. Before we get started, would you like to make any shout outs?
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=767395][color=#ffffff][b]01001[/b][/color][/url]: Before inception, I'd like thank the entire Writers team for this opportunity. Big shout outs to HackForums Staff and intellectual people on HF.

[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1957866][color=#00ffff][b]Enterpriser[/b][/color][/url]: Thank you. Tell us a little about yourself. How were you introduced to Hack Forums?
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=767395][color=#ffffff][b]01001[/b][/color][/url]: It was an ordinary day, and I was going through my Facebook Timeline, and then I saw someone from my friend list posted something related to Member of the Month. Many people liked and commented on that thing and when I ran out of curiosity. I had to open HackForums! While HackForums was entirely new to me, I didn't know what exactly a Forum is, the first look of HF was so appealing, that I signed up eventually. Hacking Section, VIP Area, Groups and high-quality Marketplace was entirely different. I joined HackForums, and it was a turning point for me. And If talk about myself, then I'm a self-motivated individual who believes in Hardwork, Will power and Dedication!

[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1957866][color=#00ffff][b]Enterpriser[/b][/color][/url]: That's what I like to hear! After browsing through your profile for a bit, I noticed that you own a SEO service. What got you into SEO and marketing?
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=767395][color=#ffffff][b]01001[/b][/color][/url]: It all started in 2013 when I saw people who are splurging thousands of dollars on "SEO". I was so eager to know what exactly SEO is. Thereafter, I spent hours on the internet, just to understand all the concepts of SEO. Soon, I met someone who saw potential in me and guided me to strive further. Maybe I was fortunate enough to get such guidance. It took me more than a year to learn everything which this Digital Marketing has to offer. Now, I can develop websites, forums, can do SEO and markeitng. Infact, I'm running my own News/Media website i.e., http://www.virtuefy.com/

[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1957866][color=#00ffff][b]Enterpriser[/b][/color][/url]: Do you still associate yourself with the "mentor" that guided you to become as successful as you are today?
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=767395][color=#ffffff][b]01001[/b][/color][/url]: Not being a braggart. He guided me but I don't associate myself with him. We don't talk much, as there is no casual communication between us. I've a zeal for learning almost everything which this Internet has to offer. I was the only one who created a forum for his online business. I cannot stick to one thing all the time. And maybe my passion for learning did play an important role. Yet, I'm thankful to every person who guided me or played an important role in my life.

[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1957866][color=#00ffff][b]Enterpriser[/b][/color][/url]: Have you ever considered being a mentor yourself and guiding others on the path of success just like your original mentor did for you?
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=767395][color=#ffffff][b]01001[/b][/color][/url]: Yes, I know how it feels when all the odds are against you. So, taking that thing into consideration, I always try my level best to help out everyone, without expecting anything in return. I reckon, I've guided alot of people and today they are more successful than me. Though, those people don't value my thoughts now ;). But its totally fine by me. Also, I don't have any mentors in life. I only have experiences, phases (good and bad). And the people I will meet, will be giving me lessons of life. I know it sounds medieval, but like I said. Its all about how you perceive and move further!

[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1957866][color=#00ffff][b]Enterpriser[/b][/color][/url]: Do you plan on doing SEO and marketing for the rest of your life or is just a hobby for you?
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=767395][color=#ffffff][b]01001[/b][/color][/url]: "So far so good" would be my saying to describe my life as of now. SEO and Marketing plays an important role for companies. Likewise, my aim is to start my own venture and work for it. As everything is getting digital, therefore all I can say is. Its going to be my side business in future or maybe not. As I'll be using my knowledge to sustain my future endeavours.

[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1957866][color=#00ffff][b]Enterpriser[/b][/color][/url]: What's the best advice you can tell someone that is just getting started with SEO and marketing?
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=767395][color=#ffffff][b]01001[/b][/color][/url]: Don't fall for E-Books, as you cannot learn Marketing unless you try it by your own. When we talk about SEO and Marketing, that means we are talking about INTERNET. Yes, Internet has everything for you (Paid and Free). So, start exploring. Maybe you may find something worthwhile and you'll learn something eventually. P.S: By Free it does not mean quality, it means a little less than what paid services has to offer!

[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=1957866][color=#00ffff][b]Enterpriser[/b][/color][/url]: That is true, free does not mean quality. I learnt that first hand. Aha. Before we wrap it up here, what is your honest opinion on Hack Forums?
[url=https://hackforums.net/member.php?action=profile&uid=767395][color=#ffffff][b]01001[/b][/color][/url]: Ah! I'm still waiting for my Testimonial to get approved. So, people will get to my know honest opinion on HackForums. :D Still, In this long journey, I earned respect, gained knowledge and today I feel so proud that I'm running a lot of services on HackForums. I didn't know that HackForums will turn me into an entrepreneur. Today, I'm running my own Internet Marketing Agency, several websites and have been acknowledged by Microsoft and Apple's Hall of Fame. It's not a Hacking Forum but a community of helpful and intellectual people. If Omni ever allows its members to give a TAG or write a Quote on HF, then mine would be:  "Everyday is a new day, you are dreaming in the dusk, but the dawn awaits." (cool)  Thank you!
[/align][/spoiler][/align]

[hr]

[color=transparent]       [/color][/size][/font]

[align=left]
[url=http://www.businessinsider.com/spacex-internet-satellite-constellation-2016-11][b]SpaceX Plans to Launch Almost 4,500 Satellites into Space[/b][/url]
Although only 1,419 active satellites are orbiting Earth as of now, the ambitious Elon Musk-owned space company SpaceX is planning to launch almost four times that amount into space at some point. This has been discovered after the company has filed an application with the FCC to launch the satellites. Each of these satellites are relatively small compared to others, as they will weigh around 850 pounds each. These satellites are going to cover an elliptical area in space, with all 4,500 covering a massive area above the Earth. According to their FCC filing, these satellites will be used for many commerical and residential broadband services. According to SpaceX, when fully optimized, these satellites will be capable of delivering gigabit internet globally. The filing also says the satellites will last from five to seven years, and decay every year after that. The project seems to be getting the funding it needs, with companies such as Google and Fidelity investing over $1 billion into the company.

[url=https://www.cnet.com/uk/products/samsung-nvme-ssd-960-evo/preview/][b]Samsung's New 960 Evo Blows the 850 Evo Away[/b][/url]
Samsung may be hinting at the decline of SATA based SSD's, with their successor to the 850 being solely M.2, meaning your computer will need either an M.2 slot, or a PCI express slot to use it. With these cons, come very, very beneficial pros. The 960 Evo has a copy speed of up to 3,200 Mbps and a write speed of 1,900 Mbps. The 960 uses the same 3D VNAND technology the 850 Evo uses, and also supports hardware encryption. The SSD will be available in 250, 500, and 1000 GB sizes, with prices ranging from $129 to $479 USD.

[url=http://www.theverge.com/2016/11/14/13630722/google-fake-news-advertising-ban-2016-us-election][b]Google to Ban Fake News From Its Ad Network[/b][/url]
With fake news lurking everywhere around the web, one of the biggest ad providers out there - Google, will begin to ban web pages peddling fake news from using its ad network. This includes fake news sites, and is an addition to the restriction of violent, hateful, or pornographic sites from using its ad network. This comes after a fake poll of president-elect Donald Trump winning the popular vote reaching the peak of the search results on Google for the search "who won the popular vote", and came slightly too late to affect sites promoting false information and news about presidential candidates. Google is the first of the ad giants to do so, which may soon change if sites such as Facebook implement the change, despite delaying a similar change earlier this year.

[/align]

[align=center][img]https://hackforums.news/assets/v3/GamingNews.png[/img][/align]

[b][color=white]Voice Actor Union Picket Continues![/color][/b]
More than 400 SAG-AFTRA members and supporters showed up for the picket at Insomniac's HQ this weekend. "We're staying out as long as it takes until the game producers decide to come back to the bargaining table and be reasonable," actor Phil LaMarr, who is a member of the union's negotiating committee with many noteworthy titles under his belt. Some of his credits include Injustice, Mortal Kombat X, and Middle Earth: Shadow of Mordor. As for the negotiations, SAG-AFTRA says that its package of proposals is "not loaded with any crazy demands." Several prominent voice actors have spoken out in support of the strike, including Roger Craig Smith (Batman, Assassin's Creed), Jennifer Hale (Mass Effect, Guild Wars), and actor Wil Wheaton. According to Deadline, only about 25 percent of video games use union voice actors. This is the first strike in the history of video game performers. SAG-AFTRA didn't want it to come down to this, but after 19 months of peaceful pleas that were ignored, they decided to take action. The gaming industry has made it hard for voice actors to prosper as well as they should for all of the hard work they put into games. Among the most reasonable proposals, was the request to limit "vocally stressful" sessions to just two hours to help prevent actors from damaging their voice. The request was promptly denied. SAG-AFTRA also asked that performers receive an addition "full-scale payment" for every 500,000 units sold, for a maximum of four secondary payments if a game sold 2 million copies. SAG-AFTRA's requests aren't outlandish, but gaming industry insiders report that almost all of them have been rejected which results in this protest. [i][size=x-small][url=http://www.gamespot.com/articles/voice-actor-union-pickets-ratchet-and-clank-dev-as/1100-6445467/] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]Project Scorpio Will Cost A Pretty Penny[/color][/b]
Microsoft's upcoming Project Scorpio system has been described as the "most powerful console ever made." As such, it's going to cost more than the Xbox One S (which starts at $300), but its exact price point remains a mystery. In an interview with Levelup.com, Phil Spencer discussed Scorpio's price at a high level, saying the system is targeted at people who want a high-end experience. "We have not announced the pricing yet, but I want to make sure that the investment we are putting into the product of Scorpio meets the demands of the higher-end consumer and that will be a higher price." Hopefully, the Scorpio will hold up to its promises unlike Sony's PS4 Pro. Spencer also called attention to the fact that the Scorpio will not be a replacement for the Xbox One. It will coexist with it; accessories and games will be compatible for both systems. This is Microsoft's attempt at building an ecosystem similar to the PC market. They want people to be able to buy consoles that meet their pricing and performance needs. The exact price of the product will be revealed shortly as Project Scorpio is slated to go on sale in holiday 2017. [i][size=x-small][url=http://www.gamespot.com/articles/xbox-boss-discusses-project-scorpios-higher-price-/1100-6445470/] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]

[b][color=white]EA CEO Discusses Diversity in the Gaming Industry[/color][/b]
Andrew Wilson, CEO of Electronic Arts, wasn't afraid to speak up and discuss diversity and representation in the Battlefield publisher's games as well as the teams who make them. Wilson fully acknowledges that the gaming community is far more diverse than it ever used to be. "Representation is really important," he said. When I started playing games, we could squint and see 200 million players. Many of those players were 14-year-old boys playing in their mother's basements. That was really what gamers were. There was this negative connotation about what being a gamer meant. Today the average age of a gamer, I think, is about 35. Nearly 50 percent of them are female, and certainly gaming transcends all forms of culture and gender and background, both socioeconomic and ethnic background." Instead of being a mandate from EA higher-ups, a push towards better inclusivity occurred organically, Wilson said. "It's really just the creators inside of our organization saying, 'Hey, I'm looking at who's playing our games. We know that they want to look into the games that we make and see people like them so that they can better relate to those games. We want to capture that.'" Wilson isn't the first of many to speak out about to lack of diversity in video games. Hopefully, with big names like Wilson speaking out, real change will follow. [i][size=x-small][url=http://www.gamespot.com/articles/ea-ceo-discusses-diversity-in-games-and-teams-that/1100-6445480/] >>Source[/url][/size][/i]
